resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: This Masters allowed me to improve my general engineering skills and aquire the official status of engineer acording to spanish law
I did an exchange year at USD where I had an awesome year and perfected my english to a C1 level

This degree has taught me a lot, from a technical point of view I specialized in Computer Science and from a human perspective it has taught me about not giving up, the value of sacrifice and my hidden love for the pursuit of knowledge

work.title: Consultant - Software Engineer
work.description: I am a member of the egates team. Our team develops the software that is used for traveler access control in many airports. I develop and manage a Java microservices environment that uses the Quarkus framework. The most important elements of our microservice architecture are: An Identity and access manager (IAM), we are using keycloak, an API Gateway developed by the team and an ELK (Elasticsearch, Logstash and Kibana) stack that is being used for centralizing logs and metrics.

work.title: Consultant - Data Engineer
work.description: I was a member of the Anomaly Detection team. I was in charge of managing and developing machine learning microservices that detect anomalies in an external application execution. Transactions are automatically analyzed in real time and alerts are triggered when a suspicious behavior is detected.

work.title: Consultant - Software Developer
work.description: I was a member of the Software development team in the cybersecurity department. My main responsability were the creation and maintenance of: Java backend applications using continuous integration through Jenkins, REST interfaces for communications and dependency management with Maven and Microservices developed in Python using the Flask framework. This microservices are used for fraud detection with machine learning and data anlytics.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
